alert.note: Alert for Northern Lycoming; Sullivan (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 9:32PM EST until February 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following areas, Northern Lycoming and Sullivan counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
